newsitem.title: USA: Mechanical Dynamics names Ryan president.
newsitem.headline: Mechanical Dynamics names Ryan president.

text.p: Mechanical Dynamics Inc said Thursday that Robert Ryan had been named president, succeeding Michael Korybalski, who continues as chairman and chief executive officer.
Ryan previously was chief operating officer.
David Peralta, formerly controller, was named vice president and chief financial officer. As CFO he succeeds James Vincke, who was named vice president of administration.
Raymond Gaynor was promoted to vice president of Asia/Pacific operations from managing director.
"We've made these changes to help us streamline company operations and to sharpen our focus on major opportunities," said Korybalski in a statement.
Mechanical Dynamics develops software used to create and test "virtual prototypes" that simulate mechanical designs on computers.
